cheatsheet.title: Create a new Web Service from XSD or XML View

intro.description:
This cheat sheet will guide you through the steps to create and optionally deploy a Web service starting with an XSD describing the structure of a Web service. This process begins by focusing on creating an XML View model defined by existing XSD files. This will be followed by steps to import/create sources and specify/customize transformations between the Source models and XML View models, and generation of Web services.
If you wish to create a Web service from an XML View, please skip down to the "Map..." step.
Note: These steps are sequential and require you to complete or skip each step before being allowed to Perform, Complete or Skip the next step.
To learn more about using cheat sheets click the help icon above.
Press "Click to Begin" button below to start.

item.title: Create a VDB
item.description:
First, you will need to create a VDB. This is where all the Web service information and models are stored on your local computer.
==========================================================================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below to create new VDB.
-- > You may skip this step if you have already imported this data.
==========================================================================================================

item.title: Import XSD
item.description:
You will now need to import one or more XSD (Schema) files that contain information on the input and output messages for the Web service.
==========================================================================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below to import files.
-- > Repeat as as needed to obtain all desired XSDs.
-- > Press "Click to Complete" button below when finished.
-- > You may skip this step if you have already imported this data.
==========================================================================================================

item.title: Create XML View Model
item.description:
XML document messages are used to provide data via Web service mappings. You will need to create one or more XML View models from your XSD Schema to define your XML documents.
==========================================================================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below to create model.
-- > Repeat as as needed to define desired models.
-- > Press "Click to Complete" button below when finished.
-- > You may skip this step if you have existing XML View Models.
==========================================================================================================

item.title: Import from Relational Data Sources
item.description:
Next, you will need to obtain the structure of the database tables and procedures of interest. This will create a Source Model of your data
==========================================================================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below import source data.
-- > Repeat as as needed to obtain all desired source data.
-- > Press "Click to Complete" button below when finished.
-- > You may skip this step if you have already imported this data.
==========================================================================================================

item.title: Map XML Views to Relational sources
item.description:
Open each mapping class in your XML View and define its transformation. Consult the documentation for information on how to connect to relational data sources.
==========================================================================================================
-- > Press "Click to Complete" button below when finished.
-- > You may skip this step if you have already imported this data.
==========================================================================================================

item.title: Test Sources and Views
item.description:
Once your VDB is complete you can test it. A VDB is complete when all views have been mapped to sources, all sources have valid connector bindings, no validation errors exist and a "green" status is displayed in the Web Service Advisor.
==========================================================================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below to execute the VDB.
-- > Repeat as as needed to verify expected results.
-- > Press "Click to Complete" button below when finished.
-- > You may skip this step.
==========================================================================================================
Note - VDB and its models must be free of errors.
==========================================================================================================

item.title: Generate Web Service Models
item.description:
Create your Web service models based on selected XML View documents.
==========================================================================================================
-- > Select one XML View document in the VDB Explorer
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below to create model.
-- > Press "Click to Complete" button below when finished.
-- > You may skip this step if you have existing Web service models.
==========================================================================================================
Note 1 - Fill in all fields to generate Web services.
Note 2 - Generated procedure queries will have no criteria. Edit procedures in transformation editor to set specific criteria.
==========================================================================================================

item.title: Create Web Service WAR File
item.description:
You can now create a WAR file to deploy to a Servlet container with the Web services defined.
==========================================================================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below to create the WAR file
-- > In the dialog, specify WAR file location on your file system, set properties, view connector bindings information and finish by clicking "OK".
==========================================================================================================
Note - VDB and its models must be free of errors.
==========================================================================================================

item.title: Summary
item.description:
The Web service has been created and is ready to deploy. Here is a summary of the steps we have taken:
1. You created a VDB that holds all the models and configuration.
2. You imported XSDs describing the input and output of the Web service.
3. You created an XML View Model with the XSD.
4. You created a Relational Source Model via Import representing the structure of the database tables and procedures.
5. You mapped the XML View Model to relational source models.
6. You used the Create Web Service wizard to generate all remaining models needed for the Web service.
7. You linked the source models to the JDBC database by creating connector bindings.
8. You created a WAR file that contains all your work and is ready to deploy to a Servlet Container.
Select "Click to Complete" to go back to the beginning of this cheat sheet.
